title: 820-3023 not turning on
message:
Hello,
this 820-3032 is dead. I noticet that the cpu is getting slightly warm after some time (i guess thats because PPVCCSA_S0_CPU, PP1V05_S0 and PP1V8_S0_CPU_VCCPLL_R are there but VCORE_S0_CPU, VCORE_S0_AXG and PP1V5_S3RS0 are missing). I checked powerrails and came to a point where i got stuck. PP1V5_S3 is the first rail thats missing. So i followed it and as far as i understand it that is how it works: 
PP1V5_S3 (missing) is created by U7300. It needs DDRVTT_EN as enable (that is missing too). DDRVTT_EN = MEMVTT_EN and MEMVTT_EN needs PLT_RESET_L to be present at Q2810. PLT_RESET_L is also missing.
Here it confuses me. As far as i know VCORE comes up first and PLT_RESET_L after that as the CPU creates it. VCORE is missing on this board and ALL_SYS_PGOOD enables VCORE. But ALL_SYS_PGOOD needs PP1V5_S3 (the missing rail from the beginning) and i am back where i startet.
So there is some point where i didn?t understand the power on sequence correctly...

title: 820-3023 not turning on
message:
You made a wrong assumption.
PP1V5_S3_P1V5S3RS0 and PP1V5_S3 is not the same thing!
The second one comes from the first one, through Q7801 (controlled by U7801).
And its enable signal is P1V5CPU_EN.
DDRVTT voltage appears last, when CPU really need to read/write DDR.

Check if R7402 is OK.

title: 820-3023 not turning on
message:
Thank you.
R7402 iscorrect 91.1 kOhm (should be 90.9 kOhm)
U7801 has no voltage at pin 1 (VIN) and pin 5.
C7205 pin 1 is not connected to C7801 pin 1 as it should be (not beeping). So i think that that could be one problem here as these two should be directly connectet according to BV and schematic.
So i guess i need to run a wire there.
PP1V5_S3_P1V5S3RS0_FET is missing completely and shorted to GND (C7345 pin 1 beeping and just 4 Ohms to GND. And the resistance of my probes is already 3 Ohms...). Should i inject 1 V (max.1.3 V if nothing happens) there and pray that something heats up?

title: 820-3023 not turning on
message:
So you have corroded 5V_S5 trace; fix that.

PP1V5_S3_P1V5S3RS0_FET comes from L7330
You didn't mention it as missing before; also broken trace?
Short on DDR voltage now???
Lift L7330 and see where the short remains.

title: 820-3023 not turning on
message:
I ran a wire and not the 5V make it to U7801. 
I am still a bit confused. Sorry for that dumb question but according to page 7 PP1V5_S3_P1V5S3RS0_FET = PPDDR_S3_REG = PP1V5_S3. And PP1V5_S3 is the missing rail. So i still didn?t got that right...
I lifted L7330 and the short is on pin 2. Pin 1 is ~ 160 Ohms so no short there...

title: 820-3023 not turning on
message:
Looks like shorted CPU; less possible to be RAM, or a capacitor.
You can try injecting voltage (NO more than 2V).
Remove heatsink, to detect if CPU heats.
You may need to give it time; as the injecting current will be low probably...

title: 820-3023 not turning on
message: I injected voltage but i cant find anything heating up except my power supply cables after some time. I set it to 1.5 V and 5.3 A (max) and if i turn it on voltage drops to 0.7 V  and current stays at 5.3 A cause its current limited. CPU and PCH stay cool as metal. Nothing really gets warm... Resistance is still as low as resistance of my multimeter probes. should i raise the voltage while power supply is on as is drops down to 0.7 V?

title: 820-3023 not turning on
message:
In fact is not injecting, if A limit is reached.
You cannot set the current, it depends of voltage injected and load value; just let A limit at max.
I use 0-24V/20A power supply, like this
[url]https://www.ebay.es/itm/AC220V-DC-0-5-12-24-48V-Adjustable-Switch-Power-Supply-Driver-Adapter-Led-Lights/332516815749?ssPageName=STRK%3AMEBIDX%3AIT&_trksid=p2060353.m2749.l2649[/url]
Exist similar models with A monitor too, but  not really needed
[url]https://www.ebay.es/itm/480W-power-supply-Adjustable-Current-limit-12V-24V-36V-48V-60V-80V-120V-220V-DC/264278771163?ssPageName=STRK%3AMEBIDX%3AIT&var=563854956982&_trksid=p2060353.m1438.l2649[/url]
0-12V/40A should be better for MacBook repairs.

title: 820-3023 not turning on
message: Thank you. I?ll get a stronger power supply soon and will try again.
